subject: AI & Agents
title: The Second AI Winter
description: A fast breakdown of The Second AI Winter for builders.

hook.text: In the late 1980s, companies poured billions into AI expert systems. Most went bankrupt.

buildup.text: Specialized AI hardware companies like Lisp Machines Inc. collapsed as PCs got cheaper.

discovery.text: Expert systems couldn't scale. Maintaining thousands of hand-coded rules was a nightmare.

twist.text: Japan's Fifth Generation Computer Project, a $400 million bet on AI, failed to meet its goals.

climax.text: By 1993, 'AI' became a dirty word. Researchers rebranded their work as 'machine learning.'

punchline.text: Same science, new name, less baggage.

quiz.question: Why did the second AI winter happen?
options: Expert systems couldn't scale and AI hardware companies collapsed
